cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi NNE of Cabo Lucrecia, Cuba and 105 mi S of Long Island, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest across the Bahamas, then turning along the southeast U.S. coast with the center forecast to skirt the Florida east coast and move northward toward coastal Georgia and South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just offshore of the east–central Florida coast (around the Flagler/Volusia county line)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of the Flagler/Volusia county line FL to Fernandina Beach FL (just south of the GA border)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning North Palm Beach FL to the Flagler/Volusia county line FL; Lake Okeechobee FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east coast, Georgia coast, and South Carolina coast within the 5-day cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) are possible at Brunswick late Friday into Saturday; a low but increasing chance (up to 27%) of sustained 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels of 3–5 ft are possible along the southeast Georgia coast if the center tracks just offshore, especially around high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands associated with Matthew could deliver 4–7 inches with locally higher amounts to coastal Georgia late Friday–Saturday, producing flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large surf, dangerous rip currents, and minor coastal erosion are expected ahead of and during the closest approach.
